lom:description.lom:string:
Your students will love DragonflyTV's SciGirls, Science for girls, by girls! These DVDs feature a group of hip, racially diverse girls from around the country having fun with science and getting down and dirty  whether its digging in the bogs, playing taiko drums, building a doghouse, snorkeling, or playing sports. The girls are engaging  they make science colorful and fun, while explaining and demonstrating science concepts and serving as role models for your female students.
You as the teacher (or parent) will appreciate the activity guides and over four hours of videos featuring the middle- and high school-aged girls performing science activities ranging from building hovercrafts to experimenting with a twirling rope to making invisible ink. Theres even a 15-minute teacher-training case study video that shows how one program used SciGirls to teach science inquiry to girls. It will help guide you as you and your students (or children) carry out the activities.
SciGirls DVDs are in 2 volumes (2 hours each) with accompanying full-color activity guides (74 and 83 pages, see samples below) on a variety of science topics that will take your female students through the full science inquiry process, from questioning and planning the experiment to interpreting and communicating their results. Youll be able to recreate the fun and exciting science experiments in each video with your students in the classroom!
